verbose_text: In addition to reemphasizing that clinical trials aiming to preserve beta-cell function should use measures of insulin secretion as the outcome measure, the data presented here suggest that continued follow-up of such individuals could provide additional evidence of the effect of therapy because few individuals, particularly children, have significant insulin secretion after 4 years, and < 5% of all individuals of any age maintain their baseline C-peptide levels at that time point.
